alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Allen; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 11:04AM CST until February 02 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... West Fork of The Calcasieu River At Sam Houston Jones SP Bayou Des Cannes Near Eunice Calcasieu River Near Kinder Calcasieu River Near Oberlin ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Calcasieu River Near Salt Water Barrier Calcasieu River Near Glenmora Bayou Nezpique Near Basile Mermentau River Near Mermentau Calcasieu River near White Oak Park For the West Fork of The Calcasie River...including Sam Houston Jones SP...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Calcasieu River...including Glenmora, Oakdale, Oberlin, Kinder, White Oak Park, Salt Water Barrier...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Bayou Nezpique...including Basile...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mermentau River...including Mermentau...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1115 AM CST. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Nezpique near Basile. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Moderate flood threat downstream including a few residences near jennings, mermentau, and silverwood. Operations at silverwood shipyard could be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CST Sunday the stage was 22.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CST Sunday was 22.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.5 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
